pages.text:
Children’s Benefit Event
Patty Jett Children’s Benefit Event
2026 Children’s Art Program Fundraising Event
Friday, January 16, 5 – 7 pm
Every summer Cedar Key Art Center hosts a 10-day program for grade school and teen students.
Named in Honor of Patty Jett, the 2026 Patty Jett Children’s Art Program will run July 21-31.
Friday January 16th the CKAC will host the fundraiser that will fund the program
Details are evolving yet expect live music, light appetizers and beverages to be served.
Donations for the Children’s Art Program will be accepted.
Patty Jett was a great supporter of both the Art Center and Children’s programs. Throughout her lifetime Patty made a memorable difference to the Cedar Key Arts Center, Summer Art Program, Shark Sewing Club, Art in the Park, the Cedar Key School and the entire Cedar Key Community.
We hope you can JOIN US for this Special Event.

Donations for the Children’s Art Program will be accepted.
Patty Jett was a great supporter of both the Art Center and Children’s programs. Throughout her lifetime Patty made a memorable difference to the Cedar Key Arts Center, Summer Art Program, Shark Sewing Club, Art in the Park, the Cedar Key School and the entire Cedar Key Community.

Main Gallery
The Cedar Key Arts Center is proud to sponsor several unique exhibits annually in our Main Gallery (October-May).
These feature top local and regional individual artists, talented artist organizations/groups and at least once a year we showcase the creativity of Cedar Key’s artistic community with open community shows. This season’s open show is themed “The Secret Life of Trees”. Special Exhibits and Member Artist shows are coordinated in the Members’ Gallery. If you are interested in exhibiting please contact us.
The public is invited to opening receptions held the first Saturday of the month between 5 – 7 pm unless otherwise noted.
The Upstairs Galleries are open every day 10 am – 5 pm. Winter hours (November – January) close at 4:00 pm. Enter through stairway located inside the Keyhole Co-op.
2025/2026 Cedar Key Arts Center Gallery Schedule
Click the link below to see our Main and Members’ Gallery Exhibits schedule
The Arts Center has planned a variety of Community Focused Events which we hope will inspire us all and help visitors enjoy our hard working and resilient coastal community. Please plan to join us.

Upcoming Special Events
Special Events Planned at the Arts Center this Season
The Arts Center has planned a variety of Community focused events which we hope will inspire us all and bring visitors to our hard working and resilient coastal community.
July 21-31 Patty Jett Summer Art Program for teens and elementary students
Sept 1-22 Keyhole Y’Art Sale
Changing Art exhibits each month October – May
Exhibits opening reception on the first Saturday of the month 5:00-7:00pm
Saturdays at the Art Center
January – April in the Sculpture Garden
Art Show & Sale
Featuring Area Artists
Old Florida Celebration of the Arts
We are excited this year to bring back our full 2 day event.
Saturday & Sunday April 11 & 12, 10 am – 5 pm
Featuring Juried OFCA Fine Artists
We are once again listed in the top 200 Fine Arts Festivals (#45)

Members
by Carol Patillo
Catherine Graham Christie
, a well known Cedar Key artist, founded the Cedar Key Arts Center in 1994 as a non-profit organization. Her generous gift of the building and property on Cedar Key’s Historic 2nd Street houses the Cedar Keyhole Artists Cooperative on the main floor and the Cedar Key Arts Center Show Gallery, Member Artist’s Gallery, photography laboratory and art studio on the second floor. As Founder and Benefactor of the CKAC she is also a Lifetime Emeritus Member of the Board of Directors.
The Arts Center Board meets regularly through the year and welcomes you to join.
Click here
for a printable Membership Application/Renewal Form.
